review: So I tried the chromecast last week & this week and it didn't work well. For three major reasons:1. It said I could not mirror my screen because my "Tablet was not optimized for screen mirroring".2. When I tried to plug it into my audio receiver, it would not project the image to the TV. IT HAS TO BE PLUGGED IN DIRECTLY TO THE TV. This is crappy, and kills this product for any kind of audiophile. No one with a home theater sound system wants to watch TV using the stock TV speakers. I know you can use a optical audio cord to output from your TV back to the receiver, but this is an extra cord I don't want to both with.3. I tried it at the hotel and it wouldn't work because the hotel has a sign-in network (not password encyrpted). Chromecast only works on WP password protected networks. It won't work on a public network (hotel, hospital, starbucks, etc).Overall, I wouldn't recommend this product for traveling or people with input config home theater systems. It's good for people that don't have another device for streaming media to their TV (Playstation, XBOX, AppleTV, etc) and also have an output configuration for sound from their TV.
author: Owen E Holder

review: Works great and works on my schools wifi (Netgear streaming did not). Easy to set up with either cell phone or PC. I didn't see any mentions on here but you can stream your own videos using Videostream app for Chrome. It allows you to stream from your local drive to your tv. Also VLC will have integration sometime in the future. It's about the same size as my Roku Stick but comes with a short HDMI extender, so it can fit just about anywhere.
